job.title: Data Scientist
job.description: Our client continues to grow and is adding a Data Scientist to their team.&nbsp;The Data Scientist will independently pursue research tasks to achieve objectives defined by senior researchers and product owners. This is not an analyst position, but rather an R&D role where the scientist works with developers, operations, and quality assurance engineers to integrate novel and state-of-the-art artificial intelligence algorithms with a high-availability, scalable platform. The Data Scientist automates the path from data to decisions.&nbsp;Here’s what you’ll be doing:&nbsp;·&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Develop and tune statistical learning models for data analysis in fraud environments.·&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Collaborate with senior researchers and cross-functional members to understand team needs and devise possible solutions.·&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Keep up-to-date with the latest technology trends.·&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Communicate results and ideas to team members and project stakeholders.·&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Implement statistical and mathematical methodologies as defined in papers and other references.·&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Validate and verify models before and after deploying to production.·&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Adhere to appropriate data management, model governance, and version control policies.&nbsp;Here’s what you bring to the team:&nbsp;·&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;3+ years project experience (or Masters + 2 years or Ph.D. + 0 years) in network science, graph theory, and supervised and unsupervised classification techniques: Bayesian analysis, support vector machines, neural networks, or boosted or bagged decision trees.·&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Successful research documented by publications and/or a Ph.D. or Master’s Degree in computational science, natural science, applied math, or engineering field.·&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Programming skills in Python, Scala, or Java, and machine learning packages such as Spark MLlib (preferred), Scikit-learn, TensorFlow, or Keras.  - ·&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Experience with large-scale data storage and retrievals like RDBMS, NoSQL databases, or HDFS.
